articles.title: ServiceNow to buy Armis for $7.75 billion as AI-fueled cyber risks surge
articles.mainIdea: ServiceNow to buy Armis for $7.75 billion as AI-fueled cyber risks surge
articles.summary: Reuters: ServiceNow to buy Armis for $7.75 billion as AI-fueled cyber risks surge. ServiceNow on Tuesday agreed to buy cybersecurity startup Armis for $7.75 billion, in the ​enterprise software maker's biggest-ever deal, as it bolsters its services ‌to help counter rising cyberattacks driven by AI adoption. Through the deal, the company aims to ‌integrate Alphabet-backed Armis' security features such as device scanning and threat detection, a crucial advantage amid sophisticated cyberattacks that have hit companies ranging from Microsoft to UnitedHealth Group. However, ServiceNow's shares fell about 3%, as investors worried over the ⁠company's recent splurge on ‌acquisitions. Related tickers mentioned: GOOG, MSFT, NOW.

articles.title: Dogs of the Dow Enhanced Income Strategy with Covered Calls
articles.mainIdea: Dogs of the Dow Enhanced Income Strategy with Covered Calls
articles.summary: Barchart: Dogs of the Dow Enhanced Income Strategy with Covered Calls. The Dogs of the Dow has long been a simple, rules-based approach to equity investing, built around owning the highest-yielding stocks in the Dow Jones Industrial Average. Each year, investors rotate into the 10 Dow components with the highest dividend yields, based on the assumption that these stocks are temporarily out of favor and may rebound over time. Related tickers mentioned: ^DJI.

articles.title: Weekly Stock List
articles.summary: Argus Research: Weekly Stock List. Third-quarter earnings season is over, and a hefty number of companies across sectors raised guidance. In fact, so many took that action that we are running this list for a second time in recent months. We view management's ability to raise guidance as a catalyst for market-beating returns in the quarters ahead, and note that raising guidance during uncertain economic times, when vision is murky, is especially difficult. The following is a partial list of companies in the Argus Fundamental Universe of Coverage at which management increased its outlook during the recent reporting season. The notable sector imbalance in our list is partially due to when sectors report in the earnings cycle. For example, Financials report early and, as such, were heavily represented in the first list we produced in late October. "Management Signals" is one of our Investment Themes as we close out 2025, and we continue to like this theme as it crosses numerous industries and generates a robust list of potential portfolio candidates. Related tickers mentioned: APTV, CAH, CVS, DRI, EXPE, FDX, GD, JBL, KDP, MCHP, MCHPP, MDT, MRNA, PH, PLTR, PYPL, RCL, RTX, TPR.
